intro: Arabis todarii, commonly known as the Armenian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has basal leaves that are lobed or toothed, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. Arabis todarii is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
